basic.floral_language:
Sedum adolphii
Floriography: happy, confidence, sunny
Sedum adolphii is a common succulent plants with short stems and fleshy leaves tightly arranged in a rosette, yellow-green leaf color turns to golden yellow to red with enough sunlight. It is cute and can be used with a variety of exquisite small plants as a miniature landscape, very popular.
Sedum adolphii likes sun, when dormant in summer, needs scattered light. Rarely blooms with pale yellow flowers.
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, sometimes flowers, light yellow flowers
basic.color: Leaf color yellow green, when sunny leaf color turning to red, green if not sufficient

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.sunlight: Summer is its dormant period, use half shade for better care, spring and autumn are its growing seasons, need plenty of sunshine
maintenance.watering: Water 2 times during summer dormancy, 20ml water every time, keep soil moist in other time, water thoroughly when soil is dry
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, dilute fertilizers following instructions,  in early summer, spring and autumn apply fertilizers once monthly
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
